cab.content: Military Secret.1036From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,Qth August 1919.(Received 7th.)10617. 6th August. Malleson wires, 5th August, repeated Constantinople and Teheran: " Telegram from Daragaz Agent to-day reports: Many Bolshevik refugees-arriving Merv from Tashkent in fear of Mahomedan rising and enemy advance from (corrupt group) directions. Kasim left has started unrest in Askabad, in which he announced that as result of Bolshevik and Afghan ultimatum Persian Government has ordered British troops leave Persia forthwith. British in great fear are already withdrawing."Am taking measures denying these rumours."
